Description: Nine fragments of a three-strand hair plaited braid made of three interlaced elements with yellow, pale green and dark brown elements intertwined. Each strand is composed of two unplied yarns in two combinations: two green, two yellow, one yellow with a dark brown elemnent or two green, two yellow, two dark brown elements. The spinning direction of the warp is 's'.
Bibliographic references: Adams et al 1999 / Kulubnarti III: The Cemeteries (p.65)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Dr William Yewdale Adams
Donated by: W S Webb Museum of Anthropology (University of Kentucky)
Additional IDs: Excavation/small finds number: 93.1.239B (excavation object cat. no.)
